_description: Layout Configuration - Defines position and size of all UI elements using normalized coordinates (0-1). Changes take effect after page reload. This system is VIEWPORT-RELATIVE, meaning elements automatically scale to any screen size.
_coordinateSystem: All positions and sizes use values from 0.0 to 1.0 (0% to 100% of viewport). Example: x:0.5 = 50% from left, w:0.25 = 25% of screen width. This makes the layout responsive to any screen size automatically.
_safeArea_explanation: Safe area creates padding around the screen edges to avoid notches (iPhone), rounded corners, and system UI. Values are fractions of viewport (0.02 = 2% padding). Elements with useSafeArea:true will stay within this safe zone.

safeArea._top: Top padding (0.02 = 2% of screen height). Avoids status bars and notches
safeArea._right: Right padding (0.02 = 2% of screen width). Avoids curved screen edges
safeArea._bottom: Bottom padding (0.02 = 2% of screen height). Avoids home indicators and gesture areas
safeArea._left: Left padding (0.02 = 2% of screen width). Avoids curved screen edges

_elements_explanation: Each element defines a UI component's position, size, and behavior. Required: id, rect. Optional: anchor, useSafeArea, zIndex, hitSlop, minSize, maxSize, aspectRatio, visible.

_tips: To move an element: change x (horizontal) or y (vertical). 0=left/top, 1=right/bottom
To resize: change w (width) or h (height). 0.1=10% of screen, 0.5=50% of screen
Anchor determines which point of the element is positioned at x,y. 'center' means the center point, 'top-left' means the top-left corner
Use bottom-anchors (bottom-left, bottom-center, bottom-right) for elements that should stay at bottom when screen resizes
Use center anchors for elements that should stay centered
hitSlop makes thin elements easier to touch. Add 0.01-0.02 to sides of thin faders/sliders
zIndex controls layering. Higher values appear on top. Keep mini buttons and controls at 10, modals at 100+
useSafeArea:true keeps elements away from notches and rounded corners. Use for elements near edges
All coordinates are relative (0-1), so the layout works on any screen size automatically
